title: FanDuel Promotes Compliance Chief to Head of Legal; Carolyn Renzin will keep her compliance duties while taking on the betting website's top legal job
text:
She began her career with FanDuel in early 2021, according to her LinkedIn profile, and previously served as the company's chief risk and compliance officer. Before joining the company, she was an assistant general counsel for JPMorgan Chase & Co., where she worked as a regulatory litigator.

Ms. Renzin also gained regulatory experience from her time at consulting firm Guidepost Solutions, where she worked with businesses under regulatory scrutiny, and as a litigation and regulatory defense partner at law firm Stillman, Friedman & Shechtman.

New York-based FanDuel started out as a fantasy sports site before joining the online sports-betting market in 2018. The company's betting business has explodedâ€”it took in eight million bets on the Super Bowl this year, double from the year before, and it had 19 million bets during college basketball's March Madness, it said.

FanDuel is owned by Dublin-based Flutter Entertainment PLC, which holds several betting brands operating around the world. So far, 35 U.S. states and the District of Columbia have legalized sports betting, according to the American Gaming Association, an industry trade group.
